conclusion: Analyze the image and question to understand the configuration of point charges and their positions.

The image shows a cube with vertices labeled as q, -q, and 2q. Point charges of 2q and -q are placed at opposite vertices along a face diagonal. Another vertex, A, is on the opposite face of the cube. The midpoint O of the line segment connecting the charges 2q and -q is marked. The cube's side length is L.
The charges are placed at vertices q and 2q of the cube.
The midpoint O of the line connecting these charges is given as having an electric field magnitude E.
To find the electric field at point A, note that A is on the opposite face, symmetric to the midpoint O with respect to the cube's center.
The electric field at point A due to the same charges is calculated using the distance from A to each charge.
Since point A is equidistant from the charges as the midpoint O was, the electric field magnitude at A will also be E.
This symmetry ensures the electric field at A is the same as at O, given the identical distances and charge magnitudes.
Therefore, the magnitude of the electric field at point A is the same as at the midpoint O, which is E.
